result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Wayne Laverne Johnson was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

Defendant is not eligible for any type of release until serving at least 3 years of initial confinement.

4/14/16: Court orders JOC to be AMENDED to reflect that Mr. Johnson MAY participate in ERP during his initial confinement period.

DRAFT - Appeals Document Index saved for: 2016AP001569 by: Cindy R Hamre
4/16/16 still needed.
7/15/16 Oral Ruling; Br.4; Judge Koschnick presiding

Case called at 10:10am [mo]
Defendant Wayne Laverne Johnson in court, in custody with Attorney Clayton Charles Griessmeyer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court questions ADA Hall as to attempts of obtaining documentation from South Carolina; ADA Hall indicates that the State did attempt to obtain court documents but due retention periods, documents has since been destroyed.

The Court questions ADA Hall on Brief
The Court questions Atty. Griessmeyer on Brief

The Court finds that Mr. Johnson is competent to represent himself today, and very likely competent to represent himself in the past.

The Court makes findings on the testimony of the Defendant and Attorney Steen.

The Court finds that Atty. Steen's performance was deficient; gives basis
The Court finds that there was NO prejudice to this Defendant

The Court notes that if a higher court finds that a collateral attack motion would have been successful, would be prejudice to Defendant; gives basis.
The Court finds that the Defendant did not make a prima facia showing as to the South Carolina and Rock County case; gives basis
Further, IF it is deemed that the Defendant did make its prima facia obligation, the State should be unable to meet its burden on this case; Court adopts reasonings of Cotton v. Mabry (Court of Appeals)

The Court applies the Doctrine of Laches and finds that the Doctrine of Laches prohibits testified from challenging the 1990 and 1996 convictions because of the passage of time and strategic advantage the Defendant has gained allowing that much time to pass before he filed challenge. 

The Court denies the motion of the Defense. 
recess: 11:15am
ad Prosequedum - for proceedings in Branch 4 on 7-15-16
Sent to Defendant at E. Racine, Janesville address 1)NOH
Oral ruling on July 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.

State's Response to Defense "Motion after Evidentiary Hearing"
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits

Case called at 1:29 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Wayne Laverne Johnson in court, in-custody, with Attorney Clayton Charles Griessmeyer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

On ERP Issue: 
Atty Griessmeyer informs the Court that the prison system is interpreting the Court's order as that Mr. Johnson is not allowed to participate in programming until serving three years of initial confinement - submits classification report, marked as Def. Exh#1
Court/Counsel agree that this was not the Court's intent. Minutes also do not reflect this, just that he should not be released until serving three years of confinement. 

Court orders JOC to be AMENDED to reflect that Mr. Johnson MAY participate in ERP during his initial confinement period.

On Ex Post Facto Issue:
Court accepts the State's position which is Schuman 186wi2.213 is ruling; the Defendant was not subjected to ex post facto legislation and so the holding in Schuman is on point and dispositive.  So Mr. Steen was not ineffective.
Recess: 1:46 pm Reconvene: 2:00 pm 

On Collateral Attack Issue: 

Larry David Steen--sworn & testifies
-Court reviews with Mr. Johnson his waiver of attorney/client privilege
-direct exam by Atty Griessmeyer
-cross exam by ADA Hall
--Def. Exh#2
-redirect exam by Atty Griessmeyer
-recross exam by ADA Hall

Wayne Laverne Johnson--sworn & testifies
-direct exam by Atty Griessmeyer
-Def. Exh#3
-cross exam by ADA Hall
-exam by the Court
Evidence Closed
Atty Griessmeyer informs the Court that he concedes that all cases but the 1990 & 1996 cases pleas were entered freely
Court finds that Pickens Case applies to pleas entered prior Klessig being decided in 1997 - for the South Carolina case in 1990 and the Rock County case 96CT89
ADA Hall informs the Court that at the time that Mr. Johnson was convicted in South Carolina, OWI was a criminal code offense, but do not know if the right to counsel was attached
Atty Griessmeyer request a week to research that issue and submit a brief to the Court - Court grants
Doctrine of Laches-Counsel agree this issue can be deferred
Arguments by Counsel - Court informs parties that It will issue written decision or get parties together for oral decision
Court finds that Attorney Steen was a credible witness, that he was willing to admit a lack of specific recollection. Court finds that Mr. Johnson was trying to be honest, but finds his credibility to be low, presents basis, including that he told Atty Griessmeyer that he did not have attorneys in some of this cases and contradicting statements to Atty Griessmeyer and those given in court today. Court finds Attorney Steen's testimony more credible that Mr. Johnson's.
Court clarifies that It would like Atty Griessmeyer to address State's section D, doctrine of laches; which is section E and the initial burden.
Court orders Atty Griessmeyer's brief due April 28th and State's reply brief due Friday, May 13th. 
Recess: 3:25 pm

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:28 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Wayne Laverne Johnson in court with Attorney Larry D. Steen. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall submits criminal case settlement form
After discussions, Court strikes the alcohol fine enhancer in Count #1

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 and 14TR3681
off-record: 1:43 - 2:13 pm for Atty Steen to confer with client

Court sentences Mr. Johnson to 8 and one half years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 4 year and one half years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. Defendant is not eligible for any type of release until serving at least 3 years of initial confinement.
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To undergo any type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Maintain avbsolute sobriety
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--Random drug and alcohol screens
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, if required by Agent
--No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid DL or Agent approval
--To pay a fine of $6200 + costs = $8627
--To pay $56.74 blood testing fee (JESO)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--Attorney fees

Conditions Not of Extended Supervision:
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Court revokes bond and orders cash bond to be used towards costs
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 2:29 pm
Motion hearing on December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Motion to impeach the defendant with prior convictions/adjudications
State's theory of admissibility of blood test result
Notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant
Jury trial on December 15/16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 8:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Wayne Johnson appears in court with Atty Larry Steen. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Johnson waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Steen confirms waiver of time limits
ADA Shock confirms there have been no bond issues
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:40 am 

NEXT: (1) FSSC scheduled for 12/9/14 at 1:30 pm (likely plea/sentencing) - Send notices (2) JT scheduled for 12/15-16/14 at 8:30 am  - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Petition for payment of attorney fees w/cover letter

Case called at 8:39 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Wayne Laverne Johnson in court with Attorney David Zarwell and Attorney Larry D. Steen. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Steen informs the Court that Mr. Johnson has retained him on this matter, would like permission to substitute as counsel
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Johnson confirms he would like substitution
ADA Hall: No objection
Court presents basis and grants substitution of counsel. Court reminds Mr. Johnson that he will have to continue making payments on Atty fees.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Zarwell indicates that he does have some time on matter and will submit final bill
Atty Steen: Came into case last week, have talked with ADA Hall briefly, are jointly requesting additional DA PTC to review discovery and squad video
ADA Hall indicates that she is unsure if there is a video, but likely will be video, as is JESO arrest. Have not yet received from law enforcement.
Court reminds Mr. Johnson that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect

NEXT: (1) Atty Zarwell to submit bill within 2 weeks (2) Schedule DA PTC 8/13/14 at 9:40 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 8/21/14 at 1:15 pm - Send notices
Consent to Act endorsed by Atty Zarwell
NOH sent to SPD//does not qualify
Attorney David Zarwell appointed//repayment order of $75 a month starting 07-31-14

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Status conference on July 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 2, 2014 at 02:40 pm.

Case called at 2:03 pm
Defendant Wayne Laverne Johnson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the Defendant's eligibility for SPD representation will depend on his custody status.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #1.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions:
-Absolute Sobriety 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all prescription medication as prescribed
-No presence in any bars, taverns or liquor stores
-Not to operate a motor vehicle 
-Defendant must appear at the 7/2/14 Pretrial Conference in the District Attorneys Office (Court does not expect the defendant to appear at the District Attorneys Office for the Pretrial Conference if he is in custody, the State will go to the jail to have the Pretrial Conference with the defendant if he is in custody)
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Defendant is to contact the Clerk of Courts Office on the next business day they are open after his release from custody to get the next SCRAM install date and time. He is then to report on that date and time provided by the Clerk of Courts for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse.

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 2:22 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 7/2/14 at 2:40 pm
Status: to be set
